verses.kjv: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,
verses.ct: From Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, chosen as an apostle and set apart for the gospel of God —

verses.kjv: (Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)
verses.ct: this gospel that God promised long ago through his prophets in the holy scriptures,

verses.kjv: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;
verses.ct: regarding his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who in his human nature was a descendant of David,

verses.kjv: And declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:
verses.ct: and who was shown to be the Son of God with power through the Holy Spirit by his resurrection from the dead.

verses.kjv: By whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:
verses.ct: Through him we received grace and the mission of an apostle, so that people from every nation would come to the obedience that faith requires — all for the honor of his name.

verses.kjv: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:
verses.ct: You are included among those who have been called to belong to Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: To all of you in Rome who are loved by God and called to be his holy people: May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.
verses.ct: First of all, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for every one of you, because your faith is being talked about all over the world.

verses.kjv: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;
verses.ct: God is my witness — the God I serve with my whole spirit as I spread the gospel of his Son — that I constantly mention you in my prayers.

verses.kjv: Making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.
verses.ct: I always ask that somehow, if it is God's will, I might finally be able to make the trip to visit you.

verses.kjv: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;
verses.ct: I deeply want to see you so that I can share some spiritual gift with you to help strengthen you.

verses.kjv: That is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.
verses.ct: What I mean is that we can encourage each other through the faith that we share.

verses.kjv: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto,) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.
verses.ct: I want you to know, brothers and sisters, that I have planned many times to come to you, but something has always prevented me until now. My goal is to see results among you, just as I have among other non-Jewish peoples.

verses.kjv: I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.
verses.ct: I have an obligation to both Greeks and non-Greeks, to both the educated and the uneducated.

verses.kjv: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.
verses.ct: That is why I am so eager to bring the gospel to you in Rome as well.

verses.kjv: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.
verses.ct: I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is God's power that brings salvation to everyone who believes — to the Jewish people first, and also to the Greeks.

verses.kjv: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, The just shall live by faith.
verses.ct: In the gospel, the righteousness of God is revealed, a righteousness that comes by faith from start to finish, just as scripture says: 'The righteous person will live by faith.'

verses.kjv: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;
verses.ct: God's anger is being revealed from heaven against all the ungodliness and unrighteousness of people who use their wickedness to suppress the truth.

verses.kjv: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.
verses.ct: What can be known about God is plain to them, because God has made it clear.

verses.kjv: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:
verses.ct: Ever since the creation of the world, God's invisible qualities — his eternal power and divine nature — have been clearly understood through what he has made. So people have no excuse.

verses.kjv: Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.
verses.ct: Although they knew God, they did not honor him as God or give him thanks. Instead, their thinking became worthless, and their senseless minds were plunged into darkness.

verses.kjv: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,
verses.ct: While claiming to be wise, they actually became fools.

verses.kjv: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.
verses.ct: They traded the glory of the immortal God for images shaped like mortal humans, birds, 4-legged animals, and reptiles.

verses.kjv: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:
verses.ct: So God handed them over to the sinful desires of their hearts, letting them degrade their own bodies with each other.

verses.kjv: Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.
verses.ct: They exchanged God's truth for a lie and worshiped and served created things rather than the Creator, who is praised forever. Amen.

verses.kjv: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:
verses.ct: Because of this, God handed them over to shameful desires. Even their women abandoned natural relations and pursued unnatural ones.

verses.kjv: And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.
verses.ct: In the same way, the men turned away from natural relations with women and burned with desire for one another. Men committed indecent acts with other men and brought on themselves the inevitable consequences of their deviation.

verses.kjv: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;
verses.ct: Since they did not think it worthwhile to hold on to the knowledge of God, God handed them over to a worthless mind, so that they do things that should never be done.

verses.kjv: Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,
verses.ct: They are overflowing with every kind of unrighteousness, sexual immorality, wickedness, greed, and malice. They are consumed with envy, murder, conflict, deception, and hostility. They are gossips,

verses.kjv: Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,
verses.ct: slanderers, God-haters, arrogant, proud, bragging, always inventing new ways to do evil, and rebellious toward their parents.

verses.kjv: Without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:
verses.ct: They lack understanding, break their promises, show no loyalty, and have no mercy.

verses.kjv: Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.
verses.ct: They know full well that God's judgment declares that those who practice such things deserve death — yet they not only keep doing them but also applaud others who do the same.
